entries.text:
We're a growing software company using open source software/modern Perl practices to build innovative e-payment, auction, and tax collection web applications.
We're looking for talented, motivated professionals committed to flawless work and customer service.
Email resume: 106686-CS-6734@grantstreet.hrmdirect.com
entries.title: We're Hiring Telecommuters - Grant Street Group
Role up! Role up! (but keep hold of your Moose and make your meta immutable)
entries.text: Andrew Solomon shows how to add dynamic roles to your *objects* and how do you make sure you are not trying to add them to the class.

entries.title: Pinto::Remote and Pinto::Server
entries.text: An article on how to install Pinto from someone who is not Jeffrey! Wolfgang Kinkeldei tried and succeeded!

entries.title: Randomly and non-destructively pick two items without replacement from an array
entries.text: Sinan Unur beautifully explained several option how solve the problem. First a 'naive', but natural solution and then a much more clever version of it.

entries.title: Perl5 Census Japan 2013
entries.text: Though I'd probably call it a survey and not a census, but the numbers are interesting. Especially comming from a country that holds the biggest Perl conference, has a very lively Perl community, but has relatively little connection to the European/USA Perl community I am more familiar with. Daisuke Maki (lestrrat) gives a peek into the Perl community in Japan.

entries.title: Outreach Program for Women Moves Forward with â‚¬1000 Pledge
entries.text: The Perl Foundation is looking for donations to cover their expenses in the outreach program for women. If I understand it correctly, the money will go to cover grants for women to get involved in the Open Source Perl community during the summer.

entries.title: Fixing Perl5 Core Bugs: Report for Month 37
entries.text: This is the TPF grant report of Dave Mitchell. He did not have much time this month and he mainly worked to unblock the release of perl 5.18.

entries.title: Improving Perl 5: Grant Report for Month 17
entries.text: This is the TPF grant report of Nicholas Clark. He mostly worked on the API for subroutine signatures. He also worked on additional security issues that have not been fixed by the earlier rehashing fix. The new fix was shipped to vendors.

entries.title: Jeffrey Thalhammer, author of Perl::Critic and Pinto
entries.text: The first interview on the Perl Maven site. Jeff Thalhammer speaks about his projects, fund-raising and money in Open Source in general.

chapters.title: Events
chapters.header: I usually list the next 3-4 events here. The list of all the events can be found on the web site. If your Perl event is not listed there, please let me know.

entries.title: YAPC::Asia Tokyo
entries.text: September 19-21, 2013, Keio University Hiyoshi Campus, Tokyo, Japan
